H0.text: The object that works best when reflecting light is a mirror.

H1.text: A camera works best when reflecting light.

H2.text: Binoculars are the object that works best when reflecting light.

H3.text: Eyeglasses are the object that works best when reflecting light.

A4.text: Mirrors that are meant to precisely concentrate parallel rays of light into a point are usually made in the shape of a paraboloid of revolution; they are used in telescopes (from radio waves to X-rays), in antennas to communicate with broadcast satellites, and in solar furnaces.

A5.text: Mirrors for radio waves (sometimes known as reflectors) are important elements of radio telescopes.
